A drug suspect was killed in a police raid in Barangay Lecheria, Calamba town in Laguna on July 3.
2 cops were wounded in a police raid against a drug suspect when he hit their motorcycle with his car while trying to escape in Barangay Maraburab, Alcala town in Cagayan on July 3.
A drug suspect was killed in a police raid in Barangay Langagan, Burgos town in Ilocos Norte on July 3.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Lapu-Lapu, Cebu on 03 Jul 2017.

Soldiers of the 24th Infantry Battalion engaged 30 New People's Army (NPA) rebels during patrols along Sitio (sub-village) Tinalban, Kilong-olao village, Boliney town area in Abra province at 3 pm on July 3. A female rebel was captured.
Property destruction: An unidentified armed group burnt down heavy equipment owned by a construction company on July 3 in Maddela town in Quirino province.

Lumad students held a protest action outside the office of the Department of Education Region 11 in in Davao City, Davao del Sur on July 3, to make the public aware of their grievances on the attacks by paramilitary.

The Philippine security forces continued their airstrikes, artillery fire and ground assaults on July 3 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. The Army said government troopers successfully took control one of the strongholds of the Maute Group within the main battle area (MBA) in Marawi on Monday. The body of a Singaporean fighter was also recovered. According to government sources, as of July 5 the ongoing military operations left at least 475 people dead - 351 militants, 85 government security forces and 39 civilians. (16 fatalities have been divided for the days of July 3, July 4 and July 5.)

Militant group Bagong Alyansang Makabayan (Bayan) staged a protest near the United States embassy on Roxas Boulevard in Manila on July 3, against the American role in the war against the Islamic State-linked Maute group in Marawi City.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Manila Bulletin
notes: A drug suspect was killed in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants at Matalam, Cotabato on 03 Jul 2017.

source: Journal (Philippines); Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star
notes: A civilian was killed in a vigilante-style attack by an unidentified gunman at Manila, Metro Manila on 03 Jul 2017. The incident is being investigated if it is related to drugs.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star
notes: A murder suspect in the killing of five members of a family in San Jose del Monte, Bulacan on June 27 was tortured and killed by suspected vigilantes on July 4. His body was dumped along Palmera Drive, Phase 7 in Barangay Sto. Cristo in San Jose del Monte.

source: Manila Bulletin; Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star

Government troops encountered NPA rebels and captured a camp at Disimungal village area in Nagtipunan town in Quirino province on July 4. No casualties were mentioned.

Government forces encountered New People's Army (NPA) rebels at Barangay Balatoc in remote Pasil town area in Kalinga on July 4 noon, leaving one soldier wounded. Reinforcement had to be sent. The military was still verifying how many of the rebels were also wounded or dead.

A powerful roadside bomb exploded along the stretch of the Cotabato-Isulan Highway in Barangay Kauran in Ampatuan town area in Maguindanao on July 4 morning. Local officials blamed the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters for the roadside bombing which went of prematurely, leaving no one hurt.
Government forces of the 50th IB encountered New People's Army (NPA) rebels in remote Pinukpuk town in Kalinga (assumed on July 4). No casualties had been reported.

Six militants were captured. Following a brief fire fight, six gunmen voluntarily surrendered to government soldiers. There were no casualties on either side.

Abu Sayyaf militants beheaded two Vietnamese hostages and dumped their bodies in Upper Tumahubong village in Sumisip town area in Basilan on July 5. The two Vietnamese were seized in November 2016 along with four other Vietnamese crew members.

The Philippine security forces continued their airstrikes, artillery fire and ground assaults on July 5 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. According to government sources, as of July 6 the ongoing military operations left at least 477 people dead - 353 militants, 85 government security forces and 39 civilians. (2 fatalities have been recorded for July 6.)

06 July. Attack helicopters were dispatched to provide air support. No casualties were mentioned.

Government forces encountered Abu Sayyaf militants in the jungles of mountainous Patikul town area in Sulu province on July 8. One of the three remaining Vietnamese hostages who had been seized in November 2016, four militants and a soldier were killed in the encounter. The Vietnamese hostage was either killed during the fighting or executed by the militants.

Six soldiers from the 86th Infantry Battalion were wounded when their vehicles were struck by a landmine in a remote village in Nagtipunan town area in Quirino province on July 11. Army officials blamed the New People's Army (NPA) for the explosion.

Police engaged a group of New People's Army rebels in a fire fight in Cataingan town area in Masbate province after land mine explosions were reported there on July 12. An undetermined number of suspected New People's Army rebels could be wounded after government troops found bloodstains in the clash site. Reports said no policeman was killed or wounded in the explosions and clash.

source: Channel News Asia; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: The Philippine security forces continued their airstrikes, artillery fire and ground assaults on July 12 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. Two soldiers were killed in friendly fire on Wednesday when a Philippine air force fighter jet missed its target. Bodies of 6 civilians believed to have been killed by IS-linked Maute group have been found by soldiers in Marawi City on Wednesday morning. According to government sources, as of July 12 the ongoing military operations left at least 529 people dead - 392 militants, 92 government security forces and 45 civilians. (11 fatalities have been recorded for July 9.)
A land mine of the New People's Army exploded in Barangay (village) Gahit, Cataingan town area in Masbate province on July 12. The blast damaged a pickup truck of a food manufacturing company.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star
notes: A drug suspect was killed in a shootout with police in Barangay Buenavista, Bayombong town in Nueva Vizcaya on July 12. A policeman was also wounded.

Members of the 4th Maneuver Platoon of the police's public safety company came under attack of a landmine planted by New People's Army rebels along the national road in Barangay Busay, Cataingan town area in Masbate province. Reports said no policeman was killed or wounded in the explosions and clash.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star
notes: 5 drug suspects were killed in a police raid in Baranga Kayaga, Kabacan city in Cotabato on July 12.

Hundreds of urban poor, including the urban group Kadamay, held a protest rally (assumed in Pasig City) on July 12, calling on the President to issue an executive order (EO) that would award government lands along the Manggahan floodway in Pasig City to them.

Patrolling government forces encountered some 40 New People's Army (NPA) rebels in Brgy. LS Sarmiento, Laak town area in southern Davao de Oro province on July 12, leaving eight rebels and a soldier dead.
A barangay (village) chairman was gunned down by unidentified assailants on July 12 in Caloocan City, Metro Manila. The victim was not on the drug watch list.

Two children were injured when unidentified gunmen shot with 40-millimeter grenades using shoulder-fire launchers at a house in Datu Anggal town, Maguindanao on July 13 evening. The victims sustained shrapnel wounds in different parts of their bodies.

A member of the New People's Army (NPA) was killed while six others were wounded during a clash between soldiers of the 20th Special Forces Company and rebels at Sitio Biwa, Titik, Leon Postigo (Bacungan), Zambonga del Norte on July 15. The fire fight lasted for ten minutes with no soldier reported harmed or injured.

Two Philippine Army soldiers of the 44th Infantry Battalion were killed and eight others wounded in fierce clashes with communist New People's Army (NPA) rebels in Barangay Tinaplan, Sindangan town area, Zamboanga del Norte province in southern Mindanao on July 15. At least two rebels were killed and one was captured.
Suspected Abu Sayyaf gunmen took five construction workers hostage and demanded P1 million for each in ransom at Barangay Martirez in Jolo town, Sulu in the early hours of July 15.

About 20 suspected Abu Sayyaf gunmen abducted four workers in a school in a southern Philippine province in Sulu province's Patikul town shortly after midnight on July 15 and seized six painters and carpenters, one of whom managed to escape and alerted the police. Army troops later rescued another worker.
A drug suspect was shot dead by suspected vigilantes at Barangay District 2 in Gamu town, Isabela on July 15.
A barangay (village) chairman was gunned down by unidentified assailants at Barangay San Gabriel in Teresa, Rizal (assumed on July 15). The motive is still unclear.

Property destruction: Around 10 suspected members of the communist New People's Army (NPA) burnt equipment of a construction firm in Barangay Tanag Ibaba, in Lopez town area on July 15 evening. The rebels torched RTY Construction Company's pay loader, three ELF trucks and a cement mixer.

The Philippine security forces continued their airstrikes, artillery fire and ground assaults on July 15 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. Two former members of the New People's Army (NPA) were shot dead by armed men believed to be their former comrades at Sitio Cagnalog, Barangay La Medalla, Pio Duran town area in Albay province on July 17 morning.

Five hundred jeepney drivers and operators staged a transport strike and held a protest rally along Elliptical Road in Quezon City on July 17, against the implementation of the public utility vehicle (PUV) modernisation programme. The protesters marched from the Quezon City Memorial Circle to Mendiola.

source: Sunstar (Philippines); Foundation for Media Alternatives; Cebu Daily News
notes: A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Carmen, Cebu on 18 Jul 2017.

Property destruction: New People's Army (NPA) rebels torched the equipment and vehicles of Mamsar Construction, including a forklift, backhoe and multi-cab cars at Surigao City, Surigao del Norte on July 18 morning. The attack was allegedly a protest move against the imminent extension of martial law in Mindanao until the end of the year.

Property destruction: New People's Army (NPA) rebels form the Front 19 attacked the Dole-Stanfilco banana plantation in Tago, Surigao del Sur on July 18 noon, where they destroyed some six hectares of banana farm and torched the company's six mini-trucks. The attack was for the company's alleged continued grabbing of farmlands of poor farmers and the use of chemicals for aerial spray that has damaged the environment and the health of the populace.

New People's Army (NPA) rebels from the Front 21 killed militiaman Oning Lumacang at Butuan City, Agusan del Norte on July 18 evening, for his alleged involvement in anti-insurgency offensives. Lumacang was a former NPA cadre who left without the consent of the rebel group. The attack was allegedly a protest move against the imminent extension of martial law in Mindanao until the end of the year.

The Philippine security forces continued their airstrikes, artillery fire and ground assaults on July 18 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. According to government sources, as of July 20 the ongoing military operations left at least 571 people dead - 427 militants, 99 government security forces and 45 civilians. (18 fatalities have been divided for the days of July 17, July 18, July 19 and July 20.)
New People's Army (NPA) rebels allegedly attacked government troops in Roxas town, Palawan on around 1pm on July 18.

Weapons seizure: New People's Army (NPA) rebels disarmed the vice mayor of Cortes town in Surigao del Sur around 6 am on July 18. The rebels took two .45-pistols, a shotgun, a sub-machine gun, two grenades, a VHF radio and bullets for a.45-pistol. The attack was allegedly a protest move against the imminent extension of martial law in Mindanao until the end of the year.

actor2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Philippine Marine Corps
notes: An improvised explosive device exploded on a roadside in the village of Bono-Bono, Bataraza town area, southern Palawan on July 18, hitting a passing military vehicle. Two members of the marines were allegedly killed in the attack. The Western Command blamed the attack on the NPA.
An Assistant Prosecutor was killed in an ambush by unidentified assailants in Taytay town, Rizal on July 18 afternoon. The motive is still unclear.
A suspected rapist was killed by suspected vigilantes and is body dumped in Pasacao, Camarines Sur on July 19.
High school students staged a protest against the Duterte administration and it's war on drugs in front of St. Scholastica's campus on Leon Guinto Street in Manila on July 18.

The Philippine security forces continued their airstrikes, artillery fire and ground assaults on July 19 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. Heavy fighting resumed before midnight Wednesday as ground forces advanced toward the main battleground in the city's central business district. According to government sources, as of July 20 the ongoing military operations left at least 571 people dead - 427 militants, 99 government security forces and 45 civilians. (18 fatalities have been divided for the days of July 17, July 18, July 19 and July 20.)

A still unidentified member of the New People's Army (NPA) was killed in an encounter with the Army's 39th Infantry Battalion in a remote village in Barangay Napalico, Arakan area, Cotabato on July 19. The dead rebel is suspected to have been part of the party that attacked a convoy of presidential guards in Arakan town.

source: Philippine Star; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect was killed by undercover police (assumed) in Barangay Bangkal, Malolos City in Bulacan on July 19.
A suspected rapist was killed by suspected vigilantes and his body dumped at Barangay Sauyo, Quezon City on July 18.

New People's Army (NPA) rebels from the Front 53 allegedly abducted a civilian agent of the Criminal Investigation and Detection Group at Barangay Katipunan, Arakan town area, North Cotabato while retreating following a clash with government soldiers on July 19. The attack was allegedly a protest move against the imminent extension of martial law in Mindanao until the end of the year.

Two soldiers were shot dead by suspected of New People's Army (NPA) rebels near a market in town of Roxas in Palawan province on July 19 morning. The soldiers were unarmed and were buying supplies when they killed.
Activists staged a protest outside the Australian Embassy in Makati, Metro Manila on July 19, against the Australian asylum policy.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Manila Bulletin
notes: A drug suspect was killed in a vigilante-style attack by an unidentified gunman at Navotas, Metro Manila on 19 Jul 2017.

A still unidentified member of the New People's Army (NPA) was killed in an encounter at Battalion in Barangay (village) Salvacion, Ragay town area in Camarines Sur on July 19 afternoon. Nobody was killed on the government side.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
notes: One militiaman of the Citizens Armed Forces Geographical Unit was killed and several soldiers, including members of Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte's security guards, were wounded in an ambush by about 100 New People's Army (NPA) guerrillas from the Front 53 at a fake checkpoint along a national road at Barangay Katipunan in Arakan area town in Mindanao's North Cotabato province on July 19 morning. The attack was allegedly a protest move against the imminent extension of martial law in Mindanao until the end of the year.

New People's Army (NPA) from the Front 68 clashed with the joint combat patrol of Bukidnon Provincial Public Safety Company and the army's 1st Special Forces Battalion in Barangay Concepcion, Pangantucan area, Bukidnon on July 19 afternoon. A police officer was killed in the fighting.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star
notes: A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Matalam, Cotabato on 20 Jul 2017.

source: Bombo Radyo; Camarines Norte News; Foundation for Media Alternatives

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Foundation for Media Alternatives; Journal (Philippines)

Two farmer activists, one of whom a member of Liga ng Manggagawang Bukid - Nueva Ecija, were shot dead in Nueva Ecija on 20 Jul 2017. Karapatan claims it to be a case of extrajudicial killings by suspected state agents (assumed military; coded the capital of Nueva Ecija as location with GP 2).

The Philippine security forces continued their airstrikes, artillery fire and ground assaults on July 20 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. Government forces cleared at least 16 buildings, took down six snipers and captured back Mapandi bridge. According to government sources, as of July 20 the ongoing military operations left at least 571 people dead - 427 militants, 99 government security forces and 45 civilians. (18 fatalities have been divided for the days of July 17, July 18, July 19 and July 20.)

notes: The human rights group Karapatan led a protest against the government's plan to extend martial law in Mindanao at Camp Aguinaldo and Camp Crame in Quezon City on July 20.

20 July. Two suspected Abu Sayyaf militants were killed and one government soldier wounded in a fire fight with government troops in a village in Patikul town area on Jolo island on July 20 during a rescue operation for four construction workers abducted on July 15. The hostages were not rescued, and pursuit operations were ongoing

source: Philippine Star; Journal (Philippines); Foundation for Media Alternatives

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; ABS CBN

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Manila Times; Ronda Balita

An official of the Calabarzon police was wounded in an ambush by unidentified armed men while fuelling up at a gas station along J.P. Rizal street in Barangay Dela Paz in Antipolo City area on July 20. The victim was shot but able to escape.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star
notes: A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Tuguegarao, Cagayan on 21 Jul 2017.

Representatives from various Indigenous Peoples and Moro organizations staged a protest rally at Cotabato City, Maguindanao on Friday, July 21, against an all-out war and the extension of martial law in Mindanao.

source: Philippine Star; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug surrenderee was killed by suspected vigilantes and found dead along the road in Barangay Poblacion, Bulacan on July 21.

The Philippine security forces continued their airstrikes, artillery fire and ground assaults on July 21 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. Government forces captured one of the Maute terror group's strongholds in Marawi City on Friday. According to government sources, as of July 21 the ongoing military operations left at least 578 people dead - 428 militants, 105 government security forces and 45 civilians. (7 fatalities have been recorded for July 21.)
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Las Pinas, Metro Manila on 21 Jul 2017.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star
notes: A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Manila, Metro Manila on 21 Jul 2017.

Five persons, including a special child, were injured when an unidentified man lobbed a hand grenade at a house of a village official at Barangay Gen. Luna in Carmen area, North Cotabato on July 21 night.

Representatives from various Indigenous Peoples and Moro organizations joined a protest rally at the Boy Scout Circle in Quezon City, Manila on Friday, July 21, against an all-out war and the extension of martial law in Mindanao.

source: Philippine Star; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect was found dead from a suspected vigilante killing in Barangay Talubatib, Labo town in Camarines Norte on July 21.
New People's Army (NPA) ambushed a local official in Barangay Magsaysay, Guihulngan area, Negros Oriental on July 21. The local official was unharmed, but his driver was killed.

New People's Army (NPA) ambushed a police team that was responding to reports of an ambush on a local official in Barangay Magsaysay, Guihulngan area, Negros Oriental province on July 21. Six police officers, including the police chief of the city of Guihulngan, were killed in the attack. The local official was unharmed, but his driver was killed. Three officers were also wounded.
Abu Sayyaf militants stormed a sawmill in Jolo Province and took two men as hostages on July 21.
Government troops of the 62nd Infantry Battalion clashed with New People's Army (NPA) rebels in (assumed rural) Calatrava area, Negros Occidental province on July 21. No casualties were reported.

source: Sunstar (Philippines); Foundation for Media Alternatives; Cebu Daily News
notes: A drug suspect was killed in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified gunmen at Minglanilla, Cebu on 22 Jul 2017.
Government troops clashed with New People's Army (NPA) rebels in the village of Caningag, Caraga town area on the weekend of July 22-23. Two were intelligence operatives were killed.

Eight youth activists (students and teachers) held a protest rally in Quezon City, Manila during the Congress joint session tackling the issue on martial law extension on July 22. The protesters were arrested.

Over 60 youth activists staged a protest at the Quezon City Police District headquarters in Camp Karingal in Quezon City, Manila on July 22 afternoon to condemn the extension of martial law in Mindanao and call for the release of 8 youth leaders who were arrested after their lightning rally during the Congress joint session at the House of Representatives.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Cebu Daily News
notes: Two drug suspects were killed during police raids at Mandaue, Cebu on 22 Jul 2017.

source: Sunstar (Philippines); Foundation for Media Alternatives; Watchmen Daily Journal

source: Philippine Star; Foundation for Media Alternatives; Manila Bulletin
notes: A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Caloocan, Metro Manila on 22 Jul 2017.

Government troops of the 81st Infantry Battalion (IB) clashed with at least 12 New People's Army (NPA) rebels for more than 30 minutes on July 22 during a security patrol at Barangay Sorioan in Salcedo, Ilocos Sur. The rebels allegedly had planned an attack on the town. At least five soldiers were wounded slightly and a female rebel was reportedly killed and several others were wounded.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star
notes: A drug suspect was killed in a police raid in Barangay District 4, Bayombong town in Nueva Vizcaya on July 22.

Government troops were attacked by New People's Army (NPA) in the town of Kitaotao in Bukindnon province on July 22. Rebels exploded an improvised explosive device and started firing at the soldiers, killing one and wounding 11.

The Philippine security forces continued their airstrikes, artillery fire and ground assaults on July 22 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. Fighting further intensified on Saturday killing 9 soldiers and leaving another 41 wounded. 4 soldiers were killed when an improvised explosive device (IED) blew up while they were clearing a building. According to government sources, as of July 21 the ongoing military operations left at least 587 people dead - 428 militants, 114 government security forces and 45 civilians. (9fatalities have been recorded for July 22.)

source: Journal (Philippines); Philippine Star; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Manila, Metro Manila on 22 Jul 2017.
Students held a protest as Philippine Defence Secretary Delfin Lorenzana spoke during a dialogue between displaced Marawi residents and government officials in Iligan City, in Mindanao on July 23.

source: Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star
notes: A drug suspect was killed in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified gunmen at Badoc, Ilocos Norte on 23 Jul 2017.
A farmer and former student activist was shot dead in Guinhulngan City, Negros Oriental on July 23. Karapatan claims it to be a case of extrajudicial killings by suspected state agents.
New People's Army (NPA) rebels attacked the Armed Forces of the Philippines (AFP) detachment in Barangay San Antonio in Kalayaan, Laguna at about midnight of July 23. No casualty was reported.

source: Philippine Star; Foundation for Media Alternatives
notes: A drug suspect was killed in a police raid in San Rafael town area in Bulacan on July 23.

Government troops of the Army's 76th Infantry Battalion clashed with about 7 suspected New People's Army (NPA) rebels for about 10 minutes while patrolling Sitio Bantigue, Cagsiay 2 in Mauban town, Quezon province on July 23. One government soldier was killed and it is assumed that rebels were at least wounded. Pursuit operations against the rebels are underway.

The Philippine security forces continued their airstrikes, artillery fire and ground assaults on July 23 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. According to government sources, as of July 28 the ongoing military operations left at least 630 people dead - 471 militants, 114 government security forces and 45 civilians. (53 fatalities have been divided for the days from July 23 to July 28.)

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Foundation for Media Alternatives; Philippine Star
notes: Two drug suspects were killed during police raids at Cainta, Rizal on 24 Jul 2017.
Evacuees staged a protest march in Marawi City, Lanao del Sur on July 24, calling for an end to martial law in Mindanao.

assoc_actor_1: BMP: Bukluran ng Manggagawang Pilipino; Sanlakas
notes: Militant groups Bukluranng Manggagawang Pilipino (BMP), Sanlakas and Partido ng Lakas ng Masa (PLM) staged a protest at the Bureau of Internal Revenue in Quezon City on July 24, to express opposition to the proposed Tax Reform for Acceleration and Inclusion program for being 'regressive' and 'anti-poor'. They also pushed for decent, affordable and safe public housing.

source: Manila Bulletin; ProtectDefenders.eu; Bulatlat; Front Line Defenders

A drug surrenderee was shot dead by suspected vigilantes at Barangay Darangutan West, San Mariano area, Isabela on July 24.
Some 300 demonstrators, led by the militant Cordillera Peoples Alliance (CPA), marched down Session Road in Baguio City, Benguet on July 24 to protest against Duterte's administration.
People took to the streets in Tagbilaran City, Bohol on July 24 to protest against the Duterte administration.

People took to the streets in Davao City, Davao del Sur on July 24 to protest against the Duterte administration. Protesters carried improvised black coffins to represent the victims of political extrajudicial killings in the region.
People took to the streets in Cebu City, Cebu on July 24 to protest against the Duterte administration.

About 1,700 protesters led by Bayan, staged a protest and burnt an effigy of a tank with President Duterte on board along with Lorenzana, Esperon and Ano at the Freedom Grandstand in Iloilo City on July 24, demanding that Duterte deliver on his election promises.
People took to the streets in Roxas City (assumed in Capiz) on July 24 to protest against the Duterte administration.

The Philippine security forces continued their airstrikes, artillery fire and ground assaults on July 24 to flush out militants from parts of Marawi city occupied by a combined Maute and Abu Sayyaf force. According to government sources, as of July 28 the ongoing military operations left at least 630 people dead - 471 militants, 114 government security forces and 45 civilians. (53 fatalities have been divided for the days from July 23 to July 28.)
Alab Katipunan-Panay, joined by around 800 mostly farmers from towns of Iloilo province, held a protest rally in Iloilo City on July 24 to protest against the Duterte administration.
People formed a human chain in Roxas, Oriental Mindoro on July 24, to protest against the Duterte administration.
People took to the streets in Kalibo in Aklan on July 24 to protest against the Duterte administration.
People took to the streets in Estancia town in Iloilo on July 24 to protest against the Duterte administration.

Several thousand left-wing protesters marched with an effigy of Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte to the House of Representatives in Quezon City to stage a protest during the President's annual State Of the Nation Address (SONA). They demanded Duterte deliver on promises made, from holding peace talks with communist insurgents to improving internet speed. Duterte later met with the protesters and asked them for patience.
People formed a human chain in San Jose, Occidental Mindoro on July 24, to protest against the Duterte administration.
Coconut farmers in Quezon province lit candles on July 24, demanding that Duterte deliver on his election promise to release the coco levy fund and speed up the government land distribution program.
People took to the streets in Bacolod City (assumed in Negros Occidental) on July 24 to protest against the Duterte administration.

Militant groups Bukluranng Manggagawang Pilipino (BMP), Sanlakas and Partido ng Lakas ng Masa (PLM) staged a protest at the Department of Natural Resource in Quezon City, Manila on July 24, demanding the termination of all coal-related projects.
People took to the streets in Tacloban City, Leyte on July 24 to protest against the Duterte administration.

One policeman was killed and three others wounded in a clash with New People's Army (NPA) rebels at Sitio Kampo 4 in Barangay Sta. Maria East of San Nicolas town area in Pangasinan province on July 28.
